column1: If a person puts the battery up the nose and breathes it further in, the following symptoms may occur: - Breathing problems - Cough - Pneumonia (if the battery goes unnoticed) - Possible complete respiratory failure A swallowed battery may cause no symptoms at all, but if it becomes stuck in the esophagus or stomach, the following symptoms may occur: - Abdominal pain - Bloody stools - Cardiovascular collapse (shock) - Chest pain - Gastrointestinal inflammation - Hole in the esophagus - Nausea - Metallic taste - Vomiting (possibly bloody)
